article:
'Baron Astley of Reading', in the County of Berkshire, was a title in the
Peerage of England. It was created in 1644 for the Royalist soldier Sir Jacob
Astley. He was a descendant of Ralph Astley (13th century), brother of Andrew de
Astley, ancestor of the Barons Astley. The title became extinct on the death of
Lord Astley of Reading's grandson, the third Baron, in 1688.

The first Baron was the uncle of Sir Isaac Astley, 1st Baronet, and the great-
uncle of Sir Jacob Astley, 1st Baronet.
categories: Baronies in the Peerage of England
Extinct baronies in the Peerage of England
